name: Careys Manor Hotel & SenSpa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in the Oakwood room which was spacious with a huge bed, the only problem was the right hand side of the bed sloped down, so wasn't as great as it could be.
reviews.title: pleasant stay at Careys Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs.
reviews.title: Very relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a disappointment as the buffet style led to dried out food with little taste - a real shame.
reviews.title: Excellent service and SPA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner at Le Blaireau on the first night - well cooked, generous steaks with good service.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay at Careys Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The treatments we booked at the senspa were exceptional - the staff were accomodating and knowledgeable and provided excellent treatments.
reviews.title: good service and good food in the new forest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed with the decor of our room and public areas - they were a little tired. We had booked a Garden room for a 2 night stay and paid extra for use of the Spa facilities, booking 4 treatments between my husband and I. We were not offered a tour of the Spa as had been mentioned in other reviews.
reviews.title: Disappointed - having read the reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Generally the hotel felt cold as did the Spa and I could not get warm.
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On our first night in the restaurant it seemed that all the waiting staff were on work experience from the College next door. The 'Head' waiter wore an ill-fitting grey suit and shoes so pointed that they curled up at the toes like a court jester. When he brought our wine to the table he asked should he open the bottle to let the wine breathe - it was a screw-top white wine!!!!!
reviews.title: A perfect countryside retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The treatments in the Spa were average - the staff were very friendly. I had booked all treatments in advance after looking at a description of them on-line, but the facial I was expecting did not seem to exist according to the therapist. I did make contact with the Spa via their web-page but received no response.
reviews.title: Alice Maguire

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were disappointed having read the reviews.
reviews.title: Has a lovely time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed for 24 hr period lunch-time to lunch-time for a Seminar. Room was booked for me by the Company. On arrival followed the signs to the main Car Park and then discovered that there was a bit of a walk to reception. Guest with any luggage would be well advised to park in the Reception Car Park to unload any luggage prior to re-positioning the car to the main Car Park. Reception was quiet and I was dealt with efficiently and with charm. I was disappointed to learn later that although I was a delegate I had been charged (highly) for the coffee I requested whilst I waited for my colleagues to arrive.
reviews.title: OK but not a counrty house hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was in the Garden Wing again a long walk from reception. It was quite small for a double but OK for one person, 2 people would have felt a little cramped. There was a balcony overlooking the garden. Along the lines of many mid-range chains the room appeared to have been recently refurbished with good quality furnishings and a nice modern bathroom. Water pressure for the shower was good.
reviews.title: As usual, a very relaxing stay
Fantastic autumn break in New Forest
reviews.text: Meals were nice with attentive service, breakfast in particular was very tasty. I did not use the Spa but I am informed by colleagues that it is very good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was fine for the purpose of our visit, no complaints at all. If however I had been expecting a country house type hotel with spacious grounds and rooms with individual character I would have been a little dissapointed.
reviews.title: Excellent on So Many Levels

likes.liked: — The spa, the restaurant, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual, excellent hotel and spa. Staff always most helpful and accommodating. Food very good.
reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed but lovely spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just the one night following a Christmas dinner and dance and wished we could have stayed another! We arrived mid afternoon and once we were shown to our room we headed off to make full use of the swimming pool, sauna and steam room (in our complimentary robes and slippers). The spa area of the hotel is superb, very clean and very well equipped. All the facilities we used were free of charge but spa treatments were available at a cost (and quite costly to be honest).
reviews.title: Loved the Charm and Fantastic Service

likes.liked: — Everything, particularly the old world charm of the reception area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: Our room was nicely furnished and decorated in pleasant pastel tones. The bed was a little on the small side for such a hotel, probably only a small double, but it was very comfortable and we slept well. The room was well away from the main reception/public areas so was very quiet. The usual coffee/tea making facilities, hairdryer, iron and ironing board and in-room safe were up to standard. Our room was on the first floor overlooking one of the garden areas and had a nice little balcony with a small table and two chairs which I wasn't expecting but, being a smoker, I was very pleased with.
reviews.title: We return every year

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was a little on the small side, but spotlessly clean with a good supply of soft white towels so no reason for complaining really.
reviews.title: Uber Spa in nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the full English breakfast the next morning and this was heaven. Unfortunately I was still rather full from our dinner the night before but the New Forest bacon, sausages and flat field mushrooms were excellent. There was a whole range of cereals, hot foods, preserves, fruit juices and assorted bread available and in my opinion well worth the charge.
reviews.title: Return visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are hoping to attend a similar event at Careys Manor next Christmas and will not hesitate to stay the night again. The reception staff were all very friendly and helpful as were the dining and bar staff. A credit to the hotel!
reviews.title: Great place to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: only stayed one night but would love to return for longer stay. Our room was rather small but comfortable. Dinner and breakfast excellant, all staff wonderfully attentive without being intrusive. Very pretty setting, to be recommended.
reviews.title: wonderful service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: My husband and I chose to stay here for a 2 night break away from the kids following the mainly positive reviews on Trip advisor. We stayed in an Oakwood Garden room which was very nice and spacious although the bathroom was a little small and the toilet flush a bit dodgy! The information booklet in the room said that no password was required to connect to the Wifi but when we tried to connect a username and password was required and on enquiring with reception she said that we did need one and suggested perhaps the booklet needed updating!
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in an excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not pay the extra £35 each to use the Senspa as I was 6 months pregnant and therefore could not make use of most of the facilities. I did however have a pregnancy massage which was excellent.
reviews.title: Good Spa hotel but can't help being a little underwhelmed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in the Manor restaurant on the first night and the food was excellent however sadly the service slowed right down after our main course was served, taking 45 minutes from clearing our plates to dessert arriving! There were only 2 waiters serving the entire restaurant and by 9pm it was full so a few extra waiters would have been good. Our waiter Shaun, who was very polite did however forget my water (although remembered about 20 minutes later!) and did not offer us any further drinks (probably as he was too busy) which we probably would have had, if he had. The second night we ate in the Zen Garden, again food excellent but the waitress forgot my husbands wine!
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a lovely hotel that we would return to as is in a great location but a few things it can improve on if it wants to become an exceptional hotel.
reviews.title: An amazing hotel and spa break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for one night in May to celebrate our anniversary.
reviews.title: Disappointing

likes.disliked: — outdated room and limited spa access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall I thought the experience was good, but it was not the "special experience" I was hoping for.
reviews.title: Wonderful rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good points:
reviews.title: Excellant experience !

likes.disliked: — shower not great quality or power

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Dinner was excellent
reviews.title: Exquisite, perfect tranquility set in a charming manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 2) The G&T was delicious
reviews.title: Great spa hotel, fantastic service
Three days of unashamed luxury
reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for a conference. The first thing that struck struck me was the helpfulness of the staff and the warmth and friendliness of the atmosphere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was just perfect with all that you would expect and more
reviews.title: Fantastic Relaxing Break !

likes.disliked: — Would have liked tighter policy on dress code at meal times.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: (slippers - take home - provided) tea and coffee making facilities, towels so soft you could sleep in them.
reviews.title: loved this well run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was quite simply the best I have ever enjoyed (apart from my wife's cooking of course!!)
reviews.title: Tatty and Overpriced

likes.disliked: — Very shabby rooms that need a refurb.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was able to enjoy a couple of relaxing hours in the Spa and Hydrotherapy pool. Wow! Total bliss!
reviews.title: An excellent stay at and excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Had 1 night stay with a friend which included lunch and dinner and several treatments. Room was as expected although the outside patio was a bonus. We had the best 2 days ever, we booked a couple of treatments which we thought were expensive, but they were brilliant, the girls in the spa were attentitive, the facilities in the spa were great and the relaxation room good. Lunch in the Zen Garden restaraunt and dinner in the Manor garden restaraunt exceeded expectations and the breakfast choice was incredible. Came away feeling so relaxed and can't wait to rebook another stay in the future.
reviews.title: Brilliant experience

likes.liked: — Good size room and outside area
likes.disliked: — hotel very fragmented with lots of corridors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008
reviews.text: Myself and my two sisters booked a Spa break at Carey's Manor for our Mum's 60th. We arrived at the beautiful manor house to a very warm, friendly welcome. After we checked in and put our bags in the gorgeous rooms we went to have lunch by the large open fire.....then spent the next 6 hours in the beautiful relaxing senspa. The evening meal was perfect, complete with a pianist and the loveliest waiting staff...not to mention the desert to die for!
reviews.title: An amazing weekend break at Carey's Manor.....can't wait to return!

likes.liked: — It was so clean, fresh and very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I couldn't fault anything about my stay at Carey's manor and will definitely return. The spa breaks are great value for money and the most enjoyable, fun way to spend a couple of days!
reviews.title: Spectacular Break in all respects!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are after a break to relax, enjoy a delicious variety of food, clean room, magnificent Spa, excellent facilities and top class service then come here.
reviews.title: Fabulous four day spa break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can honestly say that my 4 day Spa break was one of the best breaks I've ever had. Im not usually a creature of habit, but I will most certainly visit again as well as recommend Carey's Manor to my friends. I honestly cannot fault this place or praise it enough. Well done!
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were plagued with problems during our stay.
reviews.title: Great Spa - Awful Service

likes.liked: — The Spa was one of the best in the Country

reviews.title: Non- existent lunch
reviews.text: The Spa was lovely but the treatments were full for the 3 days we were there (We booked last minute).

reviews.title: Nothing like what you would expect from the website
reviews.text: The Room was ok - a little dated for the price of it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service for breakfast was terrible, brown sauce asked for while the food was given, was delivered to our table once we had finished, toast that was asked for didn’t arrive and we ended up walking out.
reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: The service in the manor restaurant too was very bad - drinks didn’t arrive, the menu was not great and a few of the dishes were unavailable. We were waiting 40 minutes for our main course which wasn't the best and was cold. The staff seemed disorganised and delivered drinks and food to the wrong tables, it seemed to be happening through out the large restaurant.
reviews.title: Experience not to be missed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just returned having spent 3 nights at the Careys Manor. We booked on a SpaBreak which was reccommended to us by friends. I have come back feeling so relaxed and chilled out, I didn't want to leave.
reviews.title: Wow - the perfect hotel

likes.liked: — the Spa, the food and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in a beautiful location in the small New Forest village of Brockenhurst. It is around 5 minutes walk to the shops and about 10minutes walk to the local pubs (The Forresters Arms was very good). the hotel itself is very well kept and the decor is nice, there are lots of beautiful flower arrangements displayed around the hotel which makes a lovely touch.
reviews.title: perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived the concierge took our bags and showed us to the room. The young lad at Reception was very friendly and directed us to the Forresters Arms and gave us some local information which was helpful as we don't know the New Forest too well. The concierge parked our car for us at no extra charge, I did not expect that but I was very impressed!
reviews.title: An amazing place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Spa is amazing. The hydrotherapy pool was glorious and me and the partner spent most of our time there. I didn't have any treatments but my partner assures me that the Swedish Massage and some sort of facial (the name escapes me) were both well worth the price.
reviews.title: Mum's Birthday Spa Break

likes.disliked: — Hotel was too hot and reception staff need more training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was also very impressive, the Thai noodles in the thai restaurant were something else! Not bad prices either. We didn't eat in the French restaurant but we did eat in the main restaurant and we were very happy.
reviews.title: Perfect bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I chose Careys for a weekend break principally because it is one of the few hotels in the New Forest that has a Spa (lets face it, January isn't usually the best time to see the Forest). Although I know the area well, I have never stayed at Careys. Now, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the Forest.
reviews.title: Best Spa in the UK!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We booked a 2 nights for 1 out-of-season deal on a standard Oakwood Garden room double which turned out to be modern, reasonably well equipped and clean. Turning the bath tap/fawcett on in our en-suite involved some degree of acrobatics to get round the fixed shower screen. Next time I will pay the £20 for an upgrade to the larger Knightwood Garden or Manor room for a little more space.
reviews.title: Lovely Christmas stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room tip; the higher room number you have the colder the room because you are further away from the main, original Manor part. We had 98 (of 100), so it was pretty cool, which was fine for us.
reviews.title: Best hotel/ spa ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The Spa was the best I have been to in the UK and certainly one of the best anywhere I have stayed. Its massive with hot and normal heated indoor pools, saunas, steam rooms, jacuzzis, quiet rooms - everywhere! When you are totally relaxed-out, try the multiple choice shower room. You can switch between Tropical Storm, Sea Storm or Ice Storm complete with thunder and lightening. Fantastic fun. Good thing its soundproofed for the Ice shower! Treatments looked a bit pricey, but during the week they often offer 20% discounts which brings it into line.
reviews.title: Dismiss negative pre-2009 reviews...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ate at the Zen Garden restaurant although they all looked nice. Big portions, good food. The decor is incredibly good taste and the strange thing is, that with the Asian staff in the Spa and Zen restaurant, French staff in the French Bistro, you really dont feel you are in the UK, until you look outside.
reviews.title: Perfect Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have just returned from our second spa break at Careys Manor, another perfect relaxing weekend. Our room was upgraded. The staff at the manor are very helpful and attentive without being intrusive. The meal in the Manor restaurant was gorgeous, beautiful presentation, service and excellent choices of food and wine. Breakfast and lunch in the Thai restaurant were excellent too. My friend and I both had treatments at Sen Spa and used the Spa facilities, all beautifully clean and faultless. Don't hesitate..... we are planning our next visit already.
reviews.title: Simply The Best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A long weekend in the New Forest as a special treat for my wife's birthday was made memorable by the joy of seeing the natural beauty of the Forest and the ponies, and the comfort and service we received in Carey's Manor Hotel made it extra special. We dined in the hotel on each of the three evenings, and the food and service in the hotel's main restaurant was first class. Sitting in front of the fire in the lounge is a relaxing way to spend the tail end of an afternoon. Our room was beautifully decorated and very clean and comfortable, and we felt welcomed from the moment we arrived.
reviews.title: Enjoyable and relaxing weekend break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had an amazing time here.lovely lovely rooms and an amazing spa!!! been here 3 times now really enjoyed it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a one night stay here for a birthday getaway for my husband. The level of customer service we received was excellent, from the minute we checked in. All of the staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and attentive. The room (an Oakwood) was good - large in size, although a smallish bathroom. It would be lovely in the summer as there was a nice patio area (not so good in Feb when it is minus 1...)
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the free dinner offer, so overall good value, and the dinner food was of a good standard. A couple of negatives - a soft mattress (common complaint of mine!) and a very disappointing breakfast. The breakfast buffet cold items were excellent - a good selection provided. However, the hot items had obviously been cooked several hours before - the eggs were cold, hard and rubbery, and the hash browns limp and soggy. Not what I was expecting!
reviews.title: Wonderful romantic stay

description: Careys Manor Hotel and Senspa is a luxury 4 star spa hotel set in the heart of the beautiful New Forest. This highly commended hotel has been voted Hotel Spa of the Year by the British Beauty Awards and awarded Gold by the Green Business Tourism Scheme. With three restaurants, there is plenty to choose from - whether you prefer fine dining in our two AA rosette Manor Restaurant, a relaxed atmosphere in Blaireaus French Bistro or want to enjoy authentic Thai cuisine in the Zen Garden Restaurant.
